Paragraph: Density functional theory calculations showed that the small portions of strong electron - withdrawing DPP in PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 could provide trap sites , which suppress efficient charge transfer.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory calculations showed that the small portions of strong electron - withdrawing DPP in PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 could provide trap sites , which suppress efficient charge transfer.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| small portions of strong electron - withdrawing DPP in PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 |
| trap sites |
| efficient charge transfer |
| Density functional theory calculations |
| PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 |
| electrons |
| withdrawing DPP |
| suppress |
| efficient charge transfer |
| provide |
| theory calculations |
| suppress efficient charge transfer |
| PBDTT-DPP25 and PBDTT-DPP10 |
| TPD75 and TPD90 |

Note: I assumed that "strong electron - withdrawing DPP" is a compound property made up of "electrons" and "withdrawing DPP". Similarly, "suppress efficient charge transfer" is a compound property made up of "suppress" and "efficient charge transfer".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| small portions of strong electron - withdrawing DPP in PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 (material properties: electron-withdrawing property of DPP, composition of PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90) |
| trap sites (material property) |
| efficient charge transfer (material property) |
| Density functional theory calculations (method) |
| PBDTT-DPP25-TPD75 and PBDTT-DPP10-TPD90 (materials) |

Note: I removed "suppress" and "provide" as they do not clearly refer to material properties. I also assumed that "strong electron - withdrawing DPP" is a material property related to the electron-withdrawing property of DPP.
